introduction.para: If you need to move your chart to another sheet, you can either move it to a new worksheet, or to an existing worksheet. Right-click on the chart (for Mac, you can use Ctrl+Click), then select Move. In the Move Chart dialog, choose New sheet, or the Object in option.

content.para: This will create a new chart sheet dedicated to displaying a single chart, so it will take up the full sheet. You may prefer this option if you want to display the chart in a slide later. The chart will be resized to fit the visible space in that new sheet, so you may need to readjust your formatting by using the chart tools.
This will move the chart to an existing worksheet you select from the drop-down box. The size and formatting of the chart will remain the same.

You can always ask an expert in the Excel Tech Communityhttps://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Excel/ct-p/Excel_Cat, get support in the Answers communityhttps://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=827514, or suggest a new feature or improvement on Excel User Voicehttps://excel.uservoice.com/.
